intro: Mecodium australe, commonly known as the Australian mecodium, is a small, flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Australia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. Mecodium australe is adapted to sandy soils and can tolerate saline conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
